programme.title: Supertato

programme.desc: Tradies. Bluey and Bingo spy on two mysterious tradies working in the backyard.

programme.title: Bluey

programme.desc: The Goggleboxers have been watching The Crown, Survivor, 007: Road to a Million, The Good Ship Murder and Shoplifters: Caught Red Handed.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Cartridge Family: Marge and Lisa are horrified when Homer buys a gun. And when Bart and Milhouse find it in the fridge, Marge takes the kids to live in a motel.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Mini Murray: Barry wants money to buy an expensive new pair of basketball shoes, so Murray hires him to work at his furniture shop so he can earn it.

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Laid-back Daniel fancies a Caribbean street parade for his nuptials, while Sabrina dreams of a more traditional event. Will their big day be carnage or carnival?

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Diane's furious to discover that her children have sneaked out. Warren makes a confession to Mercedes. And Donny sets out to confront Sully.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Theresa fears that her relationship is at risk, and a shocking accident triggers panic. Liberty's riding high after a date. And Donny makes a desperate escape in Sinbad's taxi.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip from Rude Tube's naughty little sister, Rude(ish) Tube, featuring sports of the lawnmower, motorbike and bicycle variety.

programme.title: Junior Bake Off
programme.desc: It's Cake Day for the second heat of bakers, who recreate an Australian classic and their worst nightmare in cake form! Whose dream of becoming Star Baker will come true?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Classic American: Best pals Colleen and Naomi bought Classic American in New York together, but their inexperience is pushing their friendship to the edge. Can Gordon help?

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Just Say No: As the presidential election approaches, Erica's shocked to discover that Beverly always just votes for the same candidate as Murray.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: As You Wish: Murray's happy when Adam tells him that he wants to take up a new activity at school - until he discovers that that activity is fencing.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil's Sexy, Sexy House: At Jay and Gloria's post-Thanksgiving leftovers brunch, everyone agrees to sneak into Mitch and Cam's friend's sexy, sleek house for a bit of fun.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Clean Out Your Junk Drawer: Gloria wins a bid at the school auction for a family seminar with famous doctor and self-help book author Debra Radcliffe.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Simmer Down: Short tempers, simmering tensions and downright disrespect are on the menu at Chris's troubled home-cooking caf in Georgetown, central Texas.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Spanish Pavillion: Gordon Ramsay visits Spanish Pavillion, a family-run restaurant whose owners, brothers Michael and Jerry, spend more time struggling for power than working.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Slump: Peralta has more and more cases that he can't seem to solve. Holt asks Santiago to take charge of a community outreach programme for at-risk youth.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: M.E. Time: Peralta annoys his colleagues when his attempts to get together with an attractive medical examiner delay an autopsy report.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa's Sax: The family recall the story of when Lisa got her saxophone. It all started when the school psychologist told Marge and Homer that her talent needed to be nurtured...

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Coming to Homerica: When nearby Ogdenville's unemployed come to Springfield looking for jobs, Mayor Quimby shuts the town's borders and enlists private citizens to guard them.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Couples Costume: Barry and Erica persuade Adam not to go trick-or-treating at Halloween, but to take his girlfriend Dana to visit a haunted house instead.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Lucky: Barry badgers Murray into getting him a puppy. Beverly wants to join in with Erica and Lainey's pyjama party, but they won't let her.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Express Yourself: Phil has the crazy idea of going on a spontaneous trip to Paris with Claire. And Jay takes over their bathroom renovation.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Man Shouldn't Lie: Claire brings home a stray dog and gets the kids to help her hide it. And Cameron rents out the upstairs apartment to a Christian rock band.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Bet: Peralta and Santiago's ongoing bet about who can make the most arrests comes to an awkward conclusion. Boyle gets a medal after he's shot in the line of duty.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Ebony Falcon: Sergeant Jeffords returns to the field and goes undercover at a gym with Peralta and Boyle to investigate steroid-trafficking.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Joy of Sect: The family join a cult that brainwashes its disciples into believing they will be taken to the planet Blisstonia, but Marge escapes and plans a rescue.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Das Bus: Bart, Lisa and their classmates fight to survive when they get stranded on a remote island after Otto drives the school bus off a bridge and into the sea.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna's attempts to build bridges with Cleo backfire. As Donny becomes the focus of a police investigation, Gemma takes a huge gamble. And there's a mysterious sighting at Jez's allotment.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Devil Wears Nada: Marge becomes famous when she poses for a racy charity calendar. Mr Burns promotes Carl to supervisor.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Boxer Kirsty puts her gloves down to find love. Ambitious Rose meets Hugo, who wears a cravat but has never been on a date. And can Holly kick the habit of falling for bad boys?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the 'box this time: Squid Game: The Challenge, I'm a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here!, The Crown, Deal or No Deal, Planet Earth III, Made in Chelsea and Saving Lives at Sea.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: What do Britain's top armchair critics think of Squid Game: The Challenge, The Couple Next Door, The Toy Hospital, Survivor, Vinnie Jones in the Country and Lorraine?

programme.title: The Adjustment Bureau
programme.desc: (2011) Romance meets sci-fi thriller. Matt Damon and Emily Blunt star as a politician and a dancer who begin to suspect that a shadowy group of men are interfering with their lives.

programme.title: Pearl
programme.desc: (2022) Ti West's exuberant retro horror and prequel to X. Mia Goth is Pearl - a twisted Dorothy who wants to dance up the yellow brick road to movie stardom. Can a seedy projectionist help?

programme.title: X
programme.desc: (2022) Ti West's acclaimed grindhouse horror with Mia Goth. Some adult filmmakers inexplicably choose a ramshackle house in the Bible-Belt wilderness to shoot a film. It's gonna get nasty.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Art of Racing in the Rain
programme.desc: (2019) Touching comedy-drama. An ageing golden retriever (voiced by Kevin Costner) tells the story of his life with his best pal, a budding Formula 1 driver.

programme.title: Think Like a Dog
programme.desc: (2020) Cheeky comedy with Megan Fox. A young science prodigy (Gabriel Bateman) invents a piece of tech that lets him and his pet dog communicate with each other telepathically.

programme.title: Sword of Sherwood Forest
programme.desc: (1960) Adventure with Richard Greene, Peter Cushing and a young Oliver Reed. Can Robin Hood foil the villainous Sheriff of Nottingham's evil plan to murder the Archbishop of Canterbury?

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes:...
programme.desc: ...Talking Film: Stars and directors talk about making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections. Features Danny Boyle, Amy Schumer, Chiwetel Ejiofor and more.

programme.title: Rat Race
programme.desc: (2001) Comedy. A Las Vegas casino-owner sets up a unique game for six punters: a race across America, hunting for $2m. Starring John Cleese, Rowan Atkinson and Whoopi Goldberg.

programme.title: The Greatest Showman
programme.desc: (2017) Hugh Jackman, Zac Efron and Michelle Williams star in the Golden-Globe-winning, toe-tapping smash hit musical about the life and times of P.T. Barnum, who created the circus.

programme.title: The Equalizer 2
programme.desc: (2018) Action crime thriller sequel. Denzel Washington returns as Robert McCall, who's out for revenge after ruthless killers murder an agency contact who he also considered a friend.

programme.title: The Integrity of Joseph Chambers
programme.desc: (2022) Robert Machoian's drama ponders the state of modern masculinity as a cack-handed insurance salesman played by Clayne Crawford heads solo to the woods for a fateful hunting trip.

programme.title: First Love
programme.desc: (2019) Takashi Miike's gory, violent crime-thriller. Budding boxer Leo helps a woman who's been forced into sex work but gets more than he bargained for. In Japanese/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: Getting Personal
programme.desc: Erika Jones meets gay rugby player Wayne Sharples to find out about some of the challenges he's faced growing up and why he has such a passion for his chosen sport.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: D-Day the Sixth of June
programme.desc: (1956) Wartime romance set against the background of the D-Day landings, starring Robert Taylor and Dana Wynter. A married American officer embarks on an affair with English nurse.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: (1950) Western. John Wayne plays the commander of a Texan fort at which his ex-wife (Maureen O'Hara) pitches up. Can he win back her love by saving kidnapped children from Apache raiders?

programme.title: Buchanan Rides Alone
programme.desc: (1958) Western. Randolph Scott stars as a drifter who arrives in a small border town and tangles with a group of villains after helping a wealthy young Mexican, played by Manuel Rojas.

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes:...
programme.desc: ...Talking Film: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections.

programme.title: Earth vs the Flying Saucers
programme.desc: (1956) Sci-fi thriller. Hugh Marlowe stars as a scientist who discovers Earth is threatened by a fleet of flying saucers bent on global conquest. With special effects by Ray Harryhausen.

programme.title: Entrapment
programme.desc: (1999) Action thriller starring Sean Connery as Robert 'Mac' MacDougal, one of the world's finest art thieves, and Catherine Zeta-Jones as the insurance company agent out to trap him.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation
programme.desc: (2015) Part five of the Tom Cruise action-thriller franchise. The secret agents must bring down a terrorist group, but that's not easy when the CIA are hunting you down...

programme.title: A Most Wanted Man
programme.desc: (2014) Thriller with Philip Seymour Hoffman. The arrival of a refugee in Hamburg sparks a flurry of intelligence activity. Is he an asylum seeker or a terrorist? Strong language/violence.

programme.title: Like a Boss
programme.desc: (2020) Comedy with Tiffany Haddish and Rose Byrne. When two best friends find their beauty business in dire financial difficulty, they turn to a scary CEO for help.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Bedford Incident
programme.desc: (1965) Thriller. Sidney Poitier plays a photojournalist aboard a destroyer whose commander's obsessive hunt for a Soviet sub could plunge the world into nuclear war.

programme.title: Broken Arrow
programme.desc: (1950) Western starring James Stewart. A gold prospector, tired of reprisal killings between whites and Native Americans, offers a truce to the Apaches' leader. But tensions resurface.

programme.title: Ten Tall Men
programme.desc: (1951) Comedy adventure. Burt Lancaster stars as a Foreign Legion sergeant leading nine men on a dangerous mission to prevent a Berber attack on a North African desert fort.

programme.title: Von Ryan's Express
programme.desc: (1965) Second World War adventure. Frank Sinatra stars as the leader of Allied prisoners of war attempting to slip the clutches of their Italian captors. Co-starring Trevor Howard.

programme.title: The Old Man and the Gun
programme.desc: (2018) Crime biopic. Robert Redford stars as charming 74-year-old robber Forrest Tucker. He's still robbing banks when he falls for farmer Jewel (Sissy Spacek). But the cops still want him.

programme.desc: (1995) Al Pacino and Robert De Niro star in Michael Mann's crime thriller. A cop sets out to track down a career criminal and his gang of armed robbers. Violence/strong language.
